intro: Hornera urens, commonly known as the stinkcup, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a distinctive, pungent odor, which is released when the flowers are disturbed. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Hornera urens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
